FuncDef:
The display snmp-agent trap all command displays the default and configured status of all traps in all features.
The display snmp-agent trap feature-name all command displays whether the router is enabled to send alarms of specified features to an NM station. The display snmp-agent trap all command displays the default and configured status of all traps in all features. The display snmp-agent trap feature-name all command displays whether the router is enabled to send alarms of specified features to an NM station.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a feature that generates alarms.
A simple text password is a string of 1 to 255 characters.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display snmp-agent trap feature-name aaa all
ExtraInfo:
To view the default configuration of the snmp-agent trap enable feature-name command, run the display snmp-agent trap all command.
After the router is enabled to send alarms to the NM station, run the display snmp-agent trap feature-name all command to check whether the alarm function is enabled for special features.
